result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall pay $100 fine + costs + $15 payment plan fee at rate of $50/month commencing 10/1/15 and 1st of each month until paid.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearances. Court orders debt turned over to State Debt Collections.
Payment hearing on July 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew J Jones in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached. Court reviews rights, charges and penalties. Def enters Guilty plea to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of Ct 1; Ct 2 is DRI. Parties heard. Court heard and imposes sentence:

$100 fine + costs + $15 pymt plan fee at rate of $50/month comm 10/1/15 and 1st of each month until paid
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

Defendant Matthew J Jones in custody via video with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller (may appoint). Intern Kevin Schmidt (Sempf) appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Moeller heard on Def.'s FTA (was in car accident on way to court); State heard on bond; Court orders $500 PA Bond Reinstated:   Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. RD 8/31/15 at 1:30pm and JT 10/6/15 at 8:30am in Br. 3
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.

Defendant Matthew J Jones not in court. Prosecuting Atty Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for State of Wisconsin. State heard on def's FTA for return date; Court orders warrant and revokes bond and trial is removed from calendar

Defendant, Matthew J Jones in court, Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held regarding counsel. Court sends defendant to SPD and apply; sets for Review Hearing.  Return date scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

(12:46) Defendant Matthew J Jones in custody via video with attorney Jessica M. Moeller (jail only).  Intern Kevin Schmidt (Sempf) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. stands mute; Court enters NG plea on behalf; Court finds probable cause. RD 7/6/15 at 3:30 pm & JT 8/11/15 at 8:30am in Br. 3; Court sets $500.00 PA Bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
